title: Arsenal vs Crystal Palace : Predicted lineup today and confirmed team news
body_text:
Eberechi Eze scored the winner against his former club as Arsenal beat Crystal Palace 1-0 on Sunday to extend their lead at the top of the Premier League table.
Playing against the Eagles for the first time since his £67.5million summer transfer, the England international found the back of the net with a beautiful half-volley in a tense encounter at the Emirates.
It was the south London side that started the better, Jean-Philippe Mateta proving to be a handful as Oliver Glasner’s side played with their trademark energetic counter-attacking.
Ismaila Sarr and Daniel Munoz on the right side both tested David Raya, while the Gunners struggled to break down a stubborn defence and when they did, Leandro Trossard’s effort was comfortably saved by Dean Henderson.
As has so often been the case, it was a set-piece that found the back of the net for Arsenal, as Declan Rice’s free-kick was headed into the path of Eze to score his first Premier League goal for the club.
That gave the home side some much needed confidence going into half-time and though William Saliba was forced to come off at the break, that didn’t deter them.
Bukayo Saka was denied a tap-in at the far post before Gabriel Magalhaes struck the crossbar from a corner, with Henderson beating away Rice’s rebound.

Palace grew back into the game but chances were at a minimum thanks to resolute defending and smart goalkeeping from Raya, with Mikel Arteta content to see out the narrow win.
More Trending
Saturday’s surprise defeats for Liverpool and Chelsea were a welcome boost for Arsenal, as was Manchester City’s 1-0 loss at Aston Villa.
As a result the Gunners are now four points clear at the top of the table after nine games, with fans dreaming that this year might really be their year.

Arsenal five points clear
Three points for Arsenal and their afternoon gets even better – Man City have lost to Aston Villa.
The Gunners now have a five point lead at the top of the Premier League. Bournemouth are second after beating Forest 2-0.
Full-time! Arsenal 1-0 Crystal Palace
Not Arsenal’s best performance of the season but it’s enough to get the three points.
Palace never recovered from going behind and Eze has increased his new club’s advantage at the top of the Premier League!
90+5 mins: Arsenal 1-0 Crystal Palace
Uche does well to outmuscle Lewis-Skelly on the flank but his cross is straight at Raya. Seconds remain…
90 mins: Arsenal 1-0 Crystal Palace
SIX minutes added on.
Glasner is going all out. Lerma, Sosa, Uche on. Mitchell, Wharton, Munoz off.
87 mins: Arsenal 1-0 Crystal Palace
The whole of the Emirates applauds Eze as he’s subbed off for Lewis-Skelly.
Palace have been on top and Arteta wants to see this win out now.
83 mins: Arsenal 1-0 Crystal Palace
Concern for Arteta here as Rice goes down and receives some treatment and he can’t continue. Merino replaces him.
And there’s a Premier League debut for Hincapie who replaces Calafiori
80 mins: Arsenal 1-0 Crystal Palace
Let off for Palace as Lacroix chests the ball down perfectly for Gyokeres but the defenders manage to stop him before he can get a shot away.
Up the other end, Nketiah surges forward and finds Mateta who wins a corner.
Guehi gets his head on the delivery but its over the bar.
75 mins: Arsenal 1-0 Crystal Palace
Another change for Palace. Hughes replaces Kamada.
The Eagles are starting to come back into the game but aren’t showing the quality needed in the final third. Story of their season.
71 mins: Arsenal 1-0 Crystal Palace
First sight of goal for Palace in the second-half as Munoz sends in a good cross for Nketiah but it’s a smidge high and Raya is just about able to claim it.
69 mins: Arsenal 1-0 Crystal Palace
Goal? No!
A dangerous corner is sent in toward several Gunners at the far post. Gabriel gets the last touch but it’s just gone wide.
The defender collided with the post and looks in pain but is continuing for now.
66 mins: Arsenal 1-0 Crystal Palace
A second sub for Arsenal as Saka is replaced by Martinelli.
A quiet game for the winger today.
64 mins: Arsenal 1-0 Crystal Palace
It’s taken a while but Arsenal have their first corner of the game.
Rice to take… doesn’t beat the first man. Arteta will not be happy with that…
60 mins: Arsenal 1-0 Crystal Palace
Palace need to make a change and do. Pino is off for Nketiah.
Can he haunt his old club just like Eze?
59 mins: Arsenal 1-0 Crystal Palace
Trossard nearly gets the second as he gets in behind the defence. He knows he can’t beat Henderson from a tight angle so puts it across goal for saka but Palace just about clear it in time.
Arsenal look much, much better this second-half and the Eagles are struggling to contain them.
50 mins: Arsenal 1-0 Crystal Palace
So close to 2-0!
They win a free-kick on the edge of the box as Munoz accidentally handballs. Its played short and Gabriel heads it onto the bar.
The rebound isn’t cleared and Rice thumps it goalward but Henderson saves well before Saka curls one just wide of the post!
Saliba subbed off at half-time
We’re back underway at the Emirates.
One change for Arsenal at the break as Saliba is replaced by Mosquera. That is a surprise and the Gunners will be hoping its not injury related.
Around the grounds
Plenty of goals elsewhere so far this afternoon and Arsenal fans will be delighted to know that Man City are trailing at Villa Park.
Here are the other half-time scores:
- Aston Villa 1-0 Manchester City
- Bournemouth 2-0 Nottingham Forest
- Wolves 2-2 Burnley
Half-time! Arsenal 1-0 Crystal Palace
Not the most entertaining 45 minutes you’ll ever watch but the Gunners won’t care too much.
They have the lead through Eze’s wonderful finish but they’ll want more after the break.
Palace were the better team in that half but has that goal knocked their confidence? A big team talk from Glasner is needed.
45 mins: Arsenal 1-0 Crystal Palace
Two minutes added on for the first-half.
Arsenal looking more confident now.
